fields.description:
The Rest API /rest/api/1.0/projects/{projectKey}/repos/{repositorySlug}/pull-requests/{pullRequestId}/merge?version should also have a parameter for deleting the branch afterwards. 

When you merge it via the Stash GUI you have the checkbox "Delete Branch after merging", this should be possible via the REST Api too.
fields.summary: REST API for merging a Pull Request should have a parameter for deleting the branch

fields.description: The [KB process|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASHKB/Stash+Does+Not+Start+-+Could+not+acquire+change+log+lock] is cumbersome in enterprise environments where the user running the application doesn't have direct access to the database. Design a better way to recover from the database lock.
fields.summary: Design better recovery from database lock "Could not acquire change log lock"

fields.description:
On the page https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH028/Adding+an+SSH+key+to+your+Stash+account+on+Windows, there are several places where the commands are not Windows Command Shell commands -- whoever wrote these either is not using Windows or is using some non-standard shell. For example:

cd ~/.ssh

The ~ is not something that Windows understands. What you want instead is:

cd %USERPROFILE%/.ssh

Next, under step 2, it says:

cp id_rsa* key_backup

In Windows, it's "copy" not "cp".

And under step 4, it should be made more bulletproof which directory you need to get into, so instead of

cd .ssh

it should be

cd %USERPROFILE%/.ssh

btw, if you want people to do these steps from the Git Bash prompt (since the key generation requires it to be installed anyway), then that should be stated up-front and the documentation adjusted accordingly.
fields.summary: Documentation wrong for Adding SSH keys in Windows

fields.description:
Colorblind users can't tell the difference between the red "moved/deleted" files and the green "new file" indicators by their coloring.

Having an alternative theme for them would be awesome.
fields.summary: Colorblind layout

fields.description:
"You have more users than your license allows. Pushing is disabled - purchase a license today" message even though we have less than 25 stash users.

We're using our jira directory with a stash-users and a stash-administrators group, we have the following:
16 users in 'stash-users' , 1 in 'stash-administrators', 2 in 'stash internal directory'

That's 19 users, but we still get the message regarding license use.  Is this caused by our imports of svn & git repositories where there are commits by ex-employees ?  Also, how can we resolve this ASAP, at the moment our Stash production instance is unusable.

Surely ex-employees (accounts WITHOUT access to stash) don't count against our license limit ?  I've marked a few examples.

Also, this 
KB article won't work when I can't push a .mailmap wil it ?
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASHKB/Git+error+wrongly+reports+the+number+of+licensed+users+is+exceeded
fields.summary: Stash incorrectly counts the number of users, is now unusable

fields.description:
Fast pressing Approve/Unapprove button cause wrong ordering of events in Overview.

Attached screenshot. Events in time:
Approve->Unapprove->Approve
Event on Overview Page:
Approve->Approve->Unapprove
fields.summary: Race conditions or wrong ordering of events on Pull Request Overview page

fields.description: In JIRA, after forking the main repository for a side project, the source tab no longer refers to the parent project in stash but rather the forked project.  We assume this is happening because the name of our forked project is alphabetically higher than the main project.
fields.summary: JIRA source tab shows wrong parent project on commits when repository is forked

fields.description:
After upgrade to Stash 2.9.3 I noticed that if I use Tab to autocomplete reviewer's name, the focus is changed to "Cancel" link.

*How to reproduce*
1. Create review
2. Click on Reviewers field
3. Type a few letters.
4. Using arrow keys choose someone
5. Hit Tab.

*Observed behaviour*
 * Reviewer is added
 * Focus is changed to "Cancel" link, so I cannot type another reviewer's name

*Expected behaviour*
 * Reviewer is added
 * Focus stays on the Reviewers field
fields.summary: Pressing Tab while autocomplete in Reviewers field changes focus
Merge check example: Invalid content

fields.description:
The current workaround is to manually add the dependency to your pom.xml

{noformat}
<dependencies>
    <dependency>
        <groupId>com.atlassian.sal</groupId>
        <artifactId>sal-api</artifactId>
        <version>2.10.9</version>
        <scope>provided</scope>
    </dependency>
</dependencies>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Stash plugin created from AMPS is missing a dependency on sal-api

fields.description:
When viewing a diff of a pull-request, we have the ability to view/download the  **Raw file**.

However, when I try to download the files they are getting the extension ".txt" instead of the original file extension.

Example:
!sql-file-01.png!

!sql-file-02.png!
fields.summary: Set the correct file extension when downloading raw files

fields.description:
Commits listed in the pull request should identify the *parent* commit, so it's easy to tell how the history graph will be affected.

We try to keep the history as linear as possible by rebasing when reasonable. This is hard to maintain via Stash without knowing the parent commit.
fields.summary: Pull request commits should show the parent commit

fields.description:
When a cache miss occurs, the server will first completely stream the clone pack to the cache before streaming any data to the remote client. The result is that on a cache miss, you get nothing for some time and then suddenly the 'Counting objects' feedback flies from 0 to 100%.

The user experience would be better if while the pack is being written to the cache, the first part of the pack would already be streamed to the client. 

Things to consider:

* We don't want to spin up another thread on every cache miss.
* We don't want to multiplex to the cache and the client at a fixed rate. This would slow down the overall process to the lowest common denominator.

Ideally, we'd have a single cache-miss-streamer thread that slowly streams parts of the cache-entry to the client while it is still being written. It's fine if that happens at a slower rate then the client can process.

When the cache write completes, the main thread should take over again and stream the remainder of the cache entry.
fields.summary: Improve user experience of SCM cache on cache misses

fields.description:
We needed to put a repository in read-only mode (because we don't want to have any additional commits on it)
The only way to this is by adding a repository level group permission.
It would be handy to have a checkbox 'readonly' (at the same level as 'allow public')
fields.summary: Repository read-only

fields.description:
Fortunately, I checked my cronjob logs and noticed

The current version of the backup client (1.0.0) lacks the necessary features to backup Stash 2.9.2. Please upgrade the backup client.

The upgrade guide and/or release notes for stash 2.9 should highlight that the backup client will need to be upgraded.

Thanks,
Alex
fields.summary: Stash 2.9 upgrade guide should mention backup client compatibility.

fields.description:
When a new repository is created in Stash, it does not have any branch.

We will need to push the 'master' branch to Stash repository manually.

It will be better if a default branch 'master' is created automatically when the repository is created in Stash.
fields.summary: Default branch 'master' created automatically for newly created repository

fields.description:
My Stash instance is failing to sync with Active Directory in the following way:

2013-11-26 19:48:04,180 ERROR [scheduler_Worker-5]  c.a.c.d.DbCachingDirectoryPoller Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory [ 229377 ].
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to rename user Brian to brian

I tried to enable full synchronization but it didn't help.

Here's my version information:

Build Number 2009002
Build Timestamp Wed Nov 20 06:34:18 PST 2013
Build Version 2.9.2
fields.summary: LDAP synchronization fails when user rename contains case only changes

fields.description: In some cases it would be great to manually link certain commits to one or many JIRA issues. Especially, when using Stash and JIRA for the first time with a existing code repository.
fields.summary: Add option to manually link JIRA issues

fields.description:
It would be great to get access to the repository through OpenSSH. This would allow a user and the admins to use the standard ports. 

Although the setup of this might be stuff for more experienced users, it could also provide a security advantage, because the well tested OpenSSH code is used, without the need for a own ssh implementation
fields.summary: Add repository access over OpenSSH

fields.description:
Stash Quick Search (upper right) does not allow you to search on part of a project name (you must start with the same characters). There is no wildcard option.

Example:
If I am trying to find the project for my.project.component.planParticipant.test
I cannot input "planParticipant" in the search and get any results. Instead my search string has to start with the same characters as the full Item name I am looking for, so I would need to input "my.project.component.planParticipant" at a minimum to find my project.
fields.summary: Wildcard search

fields.description:
Within a given Stash Project there is infinite list ajax logic, rather than loading the full list of repositories on initial page load. This makes it so that a CTRL+F search for a repository cannot be performed. Instead one has to scroll down, and force repositories to load before finding the wanted one.

This makes it difficult to find a repository, especially if sure the repository sits in the Stash Project the user is looking at.
fields.summary: Ability to search or filter a project's repository list

fields.description: Currently Stash supports [connecting to an Oracle DB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Connecting+Stash+to+Oracle] only using a service name. It would be nice to allow a TNS name or a SID to be specified.
fields.summary: Support connecting to Oracle with SID or TNS name

fields.description: Recent commit are listed as n days ago.  The math for this is incorrect as I found a commit from Nov 21st listed as 4 days ago and today is Nov 26th.
fields.summary: Commit Date of n days ago is incorrect

fields.description:
There doesn't seem to be a central location showing all the open pull requests I have created (compared to the inbox for the open pull requests I am a reviewer of).

When you've a lot of repositories (as we have) you're open requests can be scattered about and keeping track of them is more difficult than it needs to be.

This could be as simple as a tab on the user profile or putting them in the in-box next to ones you're a reviewer on (maybe with them not contributing to the red count icon).
fields.summary: Better visibility of open pull requests I've created

fields.description: You cannot specify {{backup.home}} with an environment variable ({{BACKUP_HOME}}).
fields.summary: Unable to override backup.home with environment variable

fields.description:
It's fairly common knowledge that too many reviewers in a code-review is a bad thing.  I'd like to be able to easily remove myself from PRs with an apology/reason.

Could we have a button to do that?  

In the past I have written comments in PR software to explain that I was removing myself and then have no longer been able to remove myself, so I'm scared to do anything but just remove myself now.  (I don't recall whether it was Stash or Bitbucket where that happened).

References:
* https://blogs.atlassian.com/2010/03/code_review_in_agile_teams_part_ii/
* http://blogs.atlassian.com/2011/07/creating_optimal_reviews/
fields.summary: Abstain button for Pull Requests

fields.description:
Scenario: We have a ton of feature branches left over from past projects, also from using source tree gitflow, only the local branch is deleted.
I want to be able to see which of these have been merged into a specified branch (i.e. master), so I can cull the old branches.

This is no benefit to stash from a technical viewpoint, but it improves the usability by reducing the number of branches a developer has to walk through.

We are only just starting to use 'pull requests' to do merges. So the existing functionality to 'delete' on merge does not apply.

Prior to stash, I would simply map a network drive to the remote repo, and use the command line to locate and prune all merged branches.
With stash, I am having to do this one at a time, via SourceTree's User Interface.
fields.summary: Ability to filter and bulk delete merged or stale branches

fields.description:
We are attempting to mirror a GitHub repository to our Stash server per these instructions:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Importing+code+from+an+existing+project#Importingcodefromanexistingproject-MirroranexistingGitrepository

Complete import attempts began by following instructions from Stash online help. The git push --all stash command failed with this error, though:

$ git push --all stash
Password for 'https://daniel.mccallum213@code.sinclair.edu': 
Counting objects: 67811, done.
Delta compression using up to 8 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (19356/19356), done.
Unable to rewind rpc post data - try increasing http.postBuffer
error: RPC failed; result=65, HTTP code = 0
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
Writing objects: 100% (67811/67811), 43.42 MiB | 5 KiB/s, done.
Total 67811 (delta 41272), reused 67630 (delta 41120)
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
Everything up-to-date

Attempts to increase http.postBuffer as suggested by Stash online help and many blog posts resulted in a different error, effectively a HTTP 404:

$ git config http.postBuffer 209715200
$ git push --all stash
Password for 'https://daniel.mccallum213@code.sinclair.edu': 
Counting objects: 67811, done.
Delta compression using up to 8 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (19356/19356), done.
Writing objects: 100% (67811/67811), 43.42 MiB | 59.62 MiB/s, done.
Total 67811 (delta 41272), reused 67630 (delta 41120)
error: RPC failed; result=22, HTTP code = 404
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
Everything up-to-date

After increasing the IIS request size limits the error changed again, but was similarly uninformative and continued to occur after a long wait, implying some sort of timeout:

$ git push --all stash
Password for 'https://daniel.mccallum213@code.sinclair.edu': 
Counting objects: 67811, done.
Delta compression using up to 8 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (19356/19356), done.
Writing objects: 100% (67811/67811), 43.42 MiB | 60.69 MiB/s, done.
Total 67811 (delta 41272), reused 67630 (delta 41120)
error: RPC failed; result=56, HTTP code = 0
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
Everything up-to-date

The same problem persisted after explicitly unsetting any request size limits in Tomcat Connector config.

We then attempted to push to the same URL, but with the hosts file configured to resolve our Stash URL (code.sinclair.edu) to 127.0.0.1 and IIS configured to accept https requests on all available IPs. This did not change the error message nor timeout-ish behavior.

The final workaround reconfigured the Git stash remote to point directly at Tomcat, i.e. port 7990 on localhost. Obviously, the import was run directly from a command prompt on the Stash host.

fields.description:
Hello,

While testing for 508 compliance for the Application Life Cycle Management / Mobile Carwash project, it was found that STASH is not in compliance with the Federal Government Accessibility policies. Below are instances where such compliance is lacking. This purpose of this ticket is to bring these issues to your attention in the hopes that they are addressed or there is a remediation plan in place.

Please see details below. We have also included a Best Practice Recommendation for each issue and issue snapshots can be accessed through the attached PDF. Thanks!

*Date Tested:* 11/05/13
*Point of Contact:* Doug Hansen; Phone: 202-447-0790; Email: Doug.Hansen@hq.dhs.gov
*DHS Component:* OCIO/MGMT/ESDO
*Project Name:* Application Life Cycle Management / Mobile Carwash
*Project Description:* Provide a streamlined testing platform to mobile applications development teams within the Federal Government
*Product Name & Version:* Atlassian STASH 2.6.5

*508 ISSUES:*
*NOTE:* See attached PDF for screen shots of each documented 508 Accessibility issue.
*Reason to Fix:* To increase 508 compatibility and compliance, as well as enhance the ability to for Atlassian tools to engage with all users, including those with disabilities.

1). Keyboard Access  21(a); 21(c) 1.1 
A.	An interactive element or function cannot be accessed or activated by keyboard. 
Example: Dropdown menu options

B.	An interactive element or function cannot be accessed or activated by keyboard. 
Example: Some "Tags" options cannot be accessed by keyboard
 
C.	Information revealed by mouseover (TITLE) is not available to keyboard-only users (i.e., there is no equivalent screen text or visual context). 
Example: Browse and Browse and Search contain instructional information in the title. 
 
D.	Information revealed by mouseover (TITLE) is not available to keyboard-only users (i.e., there is no equivalent screen text or visual context). 
Example: Icons contain information available by title only
 
E.	The visual focus does not remain within a modal dialog box until closed. 
Example: User can navigate outside of the modal box
 
Best Practice Recommendation: Make all icons, images, fields, and interactive elements and functions accessible via keyboard.
 \\ \\
\\
2). 22(a) B07 2.2 Web: Images
A. A Web image does not have an ALT, TITLE or ARIA attribute. 
Example: Profile image
 
B. A meaningful image does not have an equivalent text description (purpose and function). 
Example: Profile image
 
Best Practice Recommendation: a).Include ALT, TITLE or ARIA attribute b).Add text description to images
\\ \\
\\
3). 22(d) B22 11 Web: Style sheet Dependence
A. Relevant content or information from a meaningful image is not available. 
Example: Search icon is missing from form field, and master search options are not available
 
B.	Relevant content or information from a meaningful image is not available. 
Example: Icons are missing

C.	Programming code or other confusing elements are revealed on the page.
Example: Extra links and buttons with no identifying text

D.	Programming code or other confusing elements are revealed on the page. 
Example: Extra input box appears on the page
 
Best Practice Recommendation: a). Add relevant content or information from a meaningful image b).Remove confusing elements on page
\\ \\
\\
4). 22(g) B13 10 Web: Data Tables
A. Any data table's row or column headers are not identified programmatically. 
Example: Missing row and column scoping
 
Best Practice Recommendation: Programmatically identify a table’s row and column headers
\\ \\
\\
5). 22n B11 1.2.2 Web: Forms	
A.A Web form field has no markup to associate it to its complete instructions and cues. 
Example: Form input box is missing markup
 
B.A Web form field has no markup to associate it to its complete instructions and cues. 
Example: Escrow/add this drop down is missing the word "Escrow" in the title
 
C.If 'Label for' and 'ID' are used but are not valid HTML. 
Example: Multiple ID's assigned
 
D.Form instructions are revealed only by mouseover (TITLE) and are not available onscreen. 
Example: Extra information revealed by title only
 
E. Form instructions are revealed only by mouseover (TITLE) and are not available onscreen. 
Example: Browse and Search contain instructional information in the title
 
F. Form instructions are revealed only by mouseover (TITLE) and are not available onscreen. 
Example: Icons contain information available by title only
 
Recommended Best Practices: a). Add markup to web forms. b). Edit code for ‘Label for’ and ‘ID’. c). Enable form instructions are revealed on screen

6). 13 Web: Repetitive Content and Links		
A. There is no method to skip repetitive content. 
Recommended Best practices: Include a method to skip repetitive content
fields.summary: STASH 508 Accessibility Issues

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of December 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA  }
Hi everyone,

Thanks to everyone for voting and commenting on this suggestion. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with Bitbucket Server.

We're planning a number of improvements related to our JIRA integration; and as we are in the process of working out the requirements and dependencies involved, we're not able to provide a timeline for when this suggestion will be resolved. [Learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

Regards,

Norman Ma

Product Manager - Bitbucket Server
{panel}

The Subject should tell you all about my issue. We have some custom issue types and we would like to map them to the branching model. We love the Create Branch Link in the Jira Issue but currently we have to select the correct branch type :(
fields.summary: Settings for mapping (custom) issue types to branch model types for create branch

fields.description: It would be nice to have a default configuration defined for when a new repo is created.  Things like num required reviewers, settings for plugins (I know that is tougher) etc.
fields.summary: Manage default configuration when a new repo is created

fields.description:
Often in a pull request, many issues are raised and it is difficult to figure out which ones have been resolved.  It would be nice to put a workflow on a comment.  In other words:

Marissa makes a comment on a line of code
Sergei fixes the problem, and pushes
Sergei marks the comment as resolved
Marissa verifies that the commit resolves the problem
Marissa marks the comment as closed

Also it would be good to allow Marissa to see which comments are still not resolved/closed yet.
fields.summary: Add workflow to a comment

fields.description: As a Stash plugin developer, I'd like Stash to have 'Update' hook support in its API besides pre-receive and post-receive
fields.summary: Add 'Update' hook support to Stash API
great example of using basic auth, nice & clear

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

I'm excited to share that in Bitbucket Server 7.0 we shipped redesigned and optimized pull request page with several improvements you’ve been asking us, including word-wrapping in unified and side-by-side diffs.

You can find more information in the Bitbucket Server 7.0 [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-7-0-release-notes-990546638.html] and Pull Requests [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/review-and-discuss-a-pull-request-808488540.html].

Please, don't hesitate to leave feedback on the feature in the comments. This will help us to priorities further development.

Anton Genkin
Product Manager Bitbucket Server
{panel}
*Original message*

As a developer, I'd like to have soft word wrap in Stash Editor view to help the users to have better feasibility reading. Something like what 'Crucible' has
fields.summary: Add 'word wrap' support in Stash source and diff views

fields.description: It would be nice to have a possibility to remove and/or create multiple git-repositories at once. The process for deleting a single repository includes 3 links, which is painfully slow when dealing with dozens of repositories and wanting to clean up a project.
fields.summary: Delete/create multiple repositories at once

fields.description: The Hipchat notifications for pulls become annoying when using an automated tool that polls every few minute, for example SourceTree. This notification type should be configurable.
fields.summary: Disable Hipchat notifications for pulls

HookExternalProcessConfigurer Not configuring hooks for '/usr/bin/git merge -m Merge pull request

fields.description:
When reviewing code on a pull request I would like to be able to collapse comment-threads (essentially hiding it). This makes it easier to review when there are a lot of comments.
Expanding the collapsed comments would also be needed, obviously.
fields.summary: Collapse and Expand pull request comments

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a vulnerability in Stash which allowed unauthenticated users to commit actions on behalf of any other authorised user. In order to exploit this vulnerability, an attacker requires access to your Stash web interface.

The Stash server is only vulnerable if it has been configured to be a part of an Application link with  Trusted Applications authentication.

The vulnerability affects all supported versions of Stash up to and including 2.5.3, 2.6.4, 2.7.5 and 2.8.3. It has been fixed in the Stash security patch releases 2.5.4, 2.6.5, 2.7.6, 2.8.4. The vulnerability does not affect the Stash 2.9 and 2.10 releases.

For more information, see our [security advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Stash+security+advisory+2014-02-26].
fields.summary: Privilege escalation

fields.description:
When gravatar support is disabled, the default avatars in Stash 404 leading to the broken image icon instead of the default avatar.

This affects every screen where a user image is used, e.g. pull requests, commits list and the banner
fields.summary: Default user avatars do not load

fields.description:
We would like to be able to specify a type when creating a pull request. The suggested types are as follows:

- CODE REVIEW (or REVIEW ONLY): for intermediate code reviews
- PERSONAL USE: early stages of feature dev, just to see a diff or ask for peer opinion
- MERGE READY: ready for merging, according to authors
fields.summary: Add type modifier to pull requests

fields.description: Currently on a diff, you can only comment on the lines that have changed and the ones originally shown around the changed lines. Sometimes I want to comment on other lines, either because I've looked at the full source, or because I've told it to show more lines above or below the diff. I've had to resort to copying the lines and then pasting them into a comment in order to give context to my comment.
fields.summary: Allow comments on any line of source file
Preserve original file mode of all files in Stash source distribution
Provide authentication dates on the administration GUI

fields.description:
When adding more than 25 access/public keys, paging doesn't work in most scenarios.

Infinite scrolling a repo's access keys shows an error on the screen (I assume project is the same).  When Stash is running locally, the infinite scroll request on a repo page is trying to get:  http://localhost:7990/stash/rest/keys/latest/projects/ATLAS/repos/quokka/ssh-keys?start=25&limit=50

On the [user profile screen|http://localhost:7990/stash/plugins/servlet/ssh/keys/user], it won't show more than 25 keys (no infinite scroll/paging at all).

On the [user admin screen|http://localhost:7990/stash/admin/users/view?name=admin], infinite scroll works fine.  It's getting http://localhost:7990/stash/rest/ssh/latest/keys?start=25&limit=50&user=admin

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of December 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks to everyone for voting and commenting on this suggestion. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with Bitbucket Server.

We spend a significant amount of time on an ongoing basis to determine our product investments in Bitbucket Server. Unfortunately, we are not currently planning to address this suggestion in the next 12 months. In the last 12 months, we've resolved 10 of the top 30 feature requests, and our upcoming roadmap includes a number of other top voted suggestions, including in-browser editing, improvements to search functionality, better JIRA integration, and providing an even better code review experience.

In the meantime, we hope that everyone might consider an established 3rd-party add-on - [Pages for Bitbucket Server|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.simplenia.stash.plugins.pages/overview]. Our ecosystem is an important aspect of the product, providing flexibility where people want different or additional functionality, and maintaining simplicity where they don't.

I understand that this may be disappointing, but we believe it’s important for us to be open, honest and transparent with our customers. Product feedback is collected from a number of different sources and is evaluated when planning the product roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

Norman Ma

Product Manager - Bitbucket Server
{panel}

*Original request description:*

I want to play out static websites residing at any place in repositories to publish test results and other things with an easy git push. That would be a remarkable easy way to publish technical stuff inside enterprises.

The index.html could be marked by a special flag or name (e.g. index.stashpage) and linked resources for javascript and css should work. If used as relative links also from inside the repository.

URL structure:
https://HOST/projects/PROJECT/repos/REPO/page/SUBDIR/index.html

SUBDIR could be optional. The page should render fullsize and replace the stash browse page.
fields.summary: Static pages

fields.description:
There are a number of small bugs and issues with the branch selector (the one that shows up in the top left of the file and commit repository tabs and in individual file views):

If the branch name is longer than fits in the button then there is no way to see it:  the name is truncated and does not appear in the tooltip.  The buttons should expand if there is space and the full name should appear in the tooltip (along with the keyboard short-cut information).

When you have a branch or tag selected opening the drop-down menu selects the correct tab and ensures the selected branch/tag is visible but it doesn't permanently highlight it, instead the first entry in the list is given the permanent highlight.  Switching between the branch and tag tabs shows the first entry in the list permanently highlighted in both (even when it bares no relation to which branch or tag is currently supported).

The branch selector places a permanent highlight on one branch or tag (see above) and a mouse-over highlight.  These are the same colour (maybe the mouse-over one should be paler and over-ride the permanent highlight).

The sorting of branches and tags is not consistent: I have two repositories with the same set of branches (master and three release branches all starting with the letter "o"), in one master comes first in another it comes second (in-between the three other branches starting with "o").  At the least this list should be sorted alphanumerically (probably case insensitive) and, personally, I'd like to see the currently selected default branch (e.g. master) come first.
fields.summary: Issues with the branch selector button/menu

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – December 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone,

We have recently reviewed this issue and the overall interest in the problem. As the issue hasn't collect votes, watchers, comments, or support cases from many customers during its lifetime, it's very low on our priority list, and will not be fixed in the foreseeable future. That's why we've decided to resolve it as *Timed Out*.

Although we're aware the issue is still important to those of you who were involved in the conversations around it, we want to be clear in managing your expectations. The Bitbucket Server team is focusing on issues that have broad impact and high value, reflected by the number of comments, votes, support cases, and customers interested. Please consult the [Atlassian Bugfix Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-bug-fixing-policy-201294573.html] for more details.

We understand how disappointing this decision may be, but we hope you'll appreciate our transparent approach and communication. If you're really passionate about this suggestion, please comment with your case in detail and we'll reconsider. Atlassian will continue to watch this issue for further updates, so please feel free to share your thoughts in the comments.

Thank you,

Imran Khan
Product Manager - Bitbucket Server and Data Center
{panel}

fields.description:
If I press back, or on my laptop backspace, when trying to go "back" up the directory hierarchy navigation loops. Pressing back lands me on an empty folder which redirects back down the directory structure which undoes what I was trying to do by pressing back.  

On my laptop backspace is more convenient than moving the cursor to click on directories. 
Yes 'u' goes up (without the redirect) but I don't want to go up I want to go back. Digging up a short cut to do what I didn't know about do avoid behavior that breaks the way I use a browser is annoying. 

I'd like to be redirected when opening an empty folder but I don't want the extra history items this entails. I did not navigate through 4 folders I navigated from src to src/a/b/code in one step. (or a the very least when I press back don't redirect me "forward" again)

*Reporter*: Anund
*E-mail*: [mailto:amckague@atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Redirect on empty directory should not add extra history items

fields.description:
This can be worked around, but it's really irritating and wastes people's time until they figure it out.

How to reproduce:
1. I click on a line in a diff, the comment box appears
2. type a comment
3. for whatever reason (e.g. browser zoom level), the 'Post Comment' button is out of sight of the page
4. Click on the horizontal scroll bar to make the 'Post Comment' button visible

What happens:
The comment textarea disappears. Wwhen I click back on the same line to open another comment box, my comment has disappeared.

What I expected to happen:
The comment textarea should never disappear if any text has been typed.

This happens to different extents in both Firefox and Chromium (30.0.1599.114-0ubuntu0.12.04.3).

The difference is: on Chrome only, a comment box full of text can also be made to disappear by clicking in the box, dragging to select the text, and letting go of the mouse on the far left of the screen.
fields.summary: Clicking out of the comment textarea makes it disappear, and my comment is lost

This feature could be used to work around the one-email-per-comment issue that discourages devs from commenting on pull requests (STASH-2839).

fields.description:
In addition to zip and tar.gz archives, several Atlassian products—such as JIRA and Confluence—are available as stand-alone installation packages.  The installers include sensible defaults (which the user can override at install time) and a self-contained JRE.

Stash is only available as a zip/tar.gz archive which presents a few issues:
# Users are independently required to install Java (meeting particular version requirements) at a system level. This may interfere with other services with Java dependencies on the machine.
# In *NIX environments, users are independently required to create a dedicated system user for running Stash as a service.  The JIRA and Confluence installers offer to create system-level 'jira' and 'confluence' user accounts for their respective services.
# In *NIX environments, file and directory ownership of items in the tar.gz are a whatever uid/gid existed on the packaging system at time of creation ('jira' and 'root' in my expereince).  This ties in with the previous point regarding system users.
fields.summary: Provide Stash as a stand-alone installer

fields.description: As mentioned in STASH-4081, if the user provides bad DB connection details/credentials for the restore, they won't find out until after STASH_HOME is unpacked.  Validate the settings early.

fields.description:
Currently there is no API call or action via the UI that would allow a LDAP sync process to be cancelled while it's still running.
This improvement will help avoid situations where a sync was triggered unintentionally for a LDAP server that has thousands of users. The actual intent was to sync with a sub-set of the entire LDAP user directory.
fields.summary: Allow rolling back or cancelling of LDAP sync action

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

I'm excited to share that in Bitbucket Server 7.0 we shipped redesigned and optimized pull request page with several improvements you’ve been asking us, including quicker way to see the full context. When clicking on "Show more" the page will now show all the hidden lines instead of just 10.

You can find more information in the Bitbucket Server 7.0 [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-7-0-release-notes-990546638.html] and Pull Requests [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/review-and-discuss-a-pull-request-808488540.html].

Please, don't hesitate to leave feedback on the feature in the comments. This will help us to priorities further development.

Anton Genkin
 Product Manager Bitbucket Server
{panel}
